sentence.value: Anatoli Semyonovich Levchenko (May 5, 1941 – August 6, 1988) was a Soviet cosmonaut.
sentence.annotated-sentence: [[Anatoli Semyonovich Levchenko|Anatoli_Levchenko]] (May 5, 1941 – August 6, 1988) was a Soviet [[cosmonaut|Astronaut]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Anatoli Semyonovich Levchenko (May 5, 1941 – August 6, 1988) was a Soviet cosmonaut.
sentence.tree: nn(Levchenko/NNP-3,Anatoli/NNP-1) nn(Levchenko/NNP-3,Semyonovich/NNP-2) nsubj(cosmonaut/NN-18,Levchenko/NNP-3) dep(Levchenko/NNP-3,May/NNP-5) num(May/NNP-5,5/CD-6) num(May/NNP-5,1941/CD-8) dep(May/NNP-5,August/NNP-10) num(August/NNP-10,6/CD-11) num(August/NNP-10,1988/CD-13) cop(cosmonaut/NN-18,was/VBD-15) det(cosmonaut/NN-18,a/DT-16) amod(cosmonaut/NN-18,Soviet/JJ-17)

sentence.value: Levchenko was planned to be the back-up commander of the first Buran space shuttle flight, and in March 1987 he began extensive training for a Soyuz spaceflight, intended to give him some experience in space.
sentence.annotated-sentence: Levchenko was planned to be the back-up [[commander|Commander]] of the first [[Buran space shuttle|Buran_(spacecraft)]] [[flight|Commander]], and in [[March 1987|1987]] he began extensive [[training|Training]] for a [[Soyuz|Apollo%E2%80%93Soyuz_Test_Project]] [[spaceflight|Spaceflight]], intended to give him [[some experience|Experience]] in [[space|Space_Shuttle]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Levchenko was planned to be the back-up commander of the first Buran [[space|Space_Shuttle]] shuttle flight, and in March 1987 he began extensive training for a [[Soyuz|Apollo%E2%80%93Soyuz_Test_Project]] spaceflight, intended to give him some experience in [[space|Space_Shuttle]].

sentence.value: In December 1987, he occupied the third seat aboard the spacecraft Soyuz TM-4 to the space station Mir, and returned to Earth about a week later on Soyuz TM-3.
sentence.annotated-sentence: In [[December 1987|1987]], he occupied the third seat aboard the [[spacecraft|Spacecraft]] [[Soyuz TM-4|Soyuz_TM-4]] to [[the space station Mir|Mir]], and returned to [[Earth|Earth]] about a week later on [[Soyuz TM-3|Soyuz_TM-3]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: In December 1987, he occupied the third seat aboard the spacecraft [[Soyuz TM-4|Soyuz_TM-4]] to the space station Mir, and returned to Earth about a week later on [[Soyuz TM-3|Soyuz_TM-3]].

sentence.value: His mission is sometimes called Mir LII-1, after the Gromov Flight Research Institute shorthand.
sentence.annotated-sentence: His mission is sometimes called [[Mir LII-1|Buran_programme]], after the [[Gromov Flight Research Institute|Gromov_Flight_Research_Institute]] [[shorthand|Shorthand]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: His mission is sometimes called Mir LII-1, after the Gromov Flight Research Institute shorthand.

sentence.value: In the year following his spaceflight, Levchenko died of a brain tumor, in the Nikolay Burdenko Neurosurgical Institute in Moscow.
sentence.annotated-sentence: In [[the year|Year]] following [[his spaceflight|Spaceflight]], [[Levchenko|Anatoli_Levchenko]] died of [[a brain tumor|Brain_tumor]], in the [[Nikolay Burdenko|Nikolay_Burdenko]] [[Neurosurgical|Neurosurgery]] [[Institute|Institute]] in [[Moscow|Moscow]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: In the year following his spaceflight, [[Levchenko|Anatoli_Levchenko]] died of a brain tumor, in the Nikolay Burdenko Neurosurgical Institute in [[Moscow|Moscow]].

sentence.value: Selected as a cosmonaut on July 12, 1980.
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Selected as a cosmonaut on July 12, 1980.

sentence.value: He was married with one child.
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: He was married with one child.

sentence.value: He was awarded the titles of Hero of the Soviet Union and Pilot-Cosmonaut of the USSR and the Order of Lenin.
sentence.annotated-sentence: He was awarded [[the titles|Title]] of [[Hero of the Soviet Union|Hero_of_the_Soviet_Union]] and Pilot-Cosmonaut of [[the USSR|Soviet_Union]] and [[the Order of Lenin|Order_of_Lenin]].
